intro: Laterifissum minus, commonly known as the lesser false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for certain pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
